verses.roman:
kalpavṛkṣa-latāra-yāhāṅ sāhajika-vana
puṣpa-phala vinā keha nā māge anya dhana

synonyms: kalpa-vṛkṣa-latāra—of creepers and kalpa-vṛkṣa, or desire trees; yāhāṅ—where; sāhajika-vana—natural forest; puṣpa-phala vinā—except for fruits and flowers; keha—anyone; nā māge—does not want; anya—any other; dhana—riches.
translation: "Vṛndāvana is a natural forest of desire trees and creepers, and the inhabitants do not want anything but the fruits and flowers of those desire trees.
